title: Ribble Valley: Lancashire's Smallest Council Budget at £11.4 Million
summary: With just 3,767 transactions totalling £11.4 million, Ribble Valley publishes the smallest spending dataset in Lancashire. But limited data doesn't mean limited findings.
author: Ribble Valley Council Transparency

title: Ribble Valley Duplicates: £174K Flagged in Two Years of Data
summary: Even with just two years of spending data, our analysis flagged £174,500 in likely duplicate payments across 35 groups — a rate of 1.5% of total spend.
author: Ribble Valley Council Transparency

title: Crime in Ribble Valley: Lancashire's Safest Borough
summary: With an average of just 310 crimes per month across 26 wards, Ribble Valley has the lowest crime rate of any Lancashire district we monitor. Derby & Thornley and Salthill are the busiest wards.
author: Ribble Valley Council Transparency

title: Ribble Valley's Band D Council Tax: £170.69 — Lancashire's Lowest
summary: Ribble Valley charges the lowest Band D council tax of any Lancashire district at £170.69. Combined with the lowest crime rate and highest average property values, it tells the story of a borough with very different pressures.
author: Ribble Valley Council Transparency

title: Ribble Valley Procurement: A Small Council's Supplier Landscape
summary: With 672 suppliers sharing £11.4 million, Ribble Valley has a low supplier concentration (HHI: 171) suggesting good competition despite its small scale.
author: Ribble Valley Council Transparency
